Package utility

Class Bio

java.lang.Object
utility.Bio
public final class Bio
extends java.lang.Object
Comprises static methods used to solve specifically bioinformatics problems.
Since:
2.0
Version:
2.0
Author:
Simon Hackl

  • Method Details

    • getSequenceFromTable

      public static java.lang.String getSequenceFromTable​(VariantPositionsTable table, java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, java.lang.String sampleName, java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> positions, boolean addDeletions, boolean addInsertions)
      Constructs and returns a nucleotide sequence as String for the specified sample by using the specified variants table, reference feature and positions.

      The boolean parameters `addDeletions` and `addInsertions` indicate whether insertion and deletion information of the sample should be included into the constructed sequence.

      Parameters:
      table - VariantPositionsTable from which variant contents are retrieved.
      referenceAnalysisId - String specifying the reference feature to which regard the sequence is constructed.
      sampleName - String specifying the sample which variant contents should be incoorporated into the sequence.
      positions - java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> specifying which positions are used to construct the sequence; this should be `table.getAllPositionsIterator(referenceAnalysisId)` in order to obtain a biologically meaningful result.
      addDeletions - Boolean whether deletions of the specified sample should be considered, i.e. if the sample shows a deletion on a specific position this position is skipped for constructing the sequence.
      addInsertions - Boolean whether insertions of the specified sample should be considered.
      Returns:
      String representing the reconstructed nucleotide sequence.

    • getInsertionsOfSample

      public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> getInsertionsOfSample​(VariantPositionsTable table, java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, java.lang.String sampleName, java.util.NavigableSet<java.lang.String> positions, boolean asSense) throws MusialBioException
      Constructs and returns a HashMap mapping String representations of genome positions to Strings representing inserted nucleotide sequences with regard to one analyzed sample.

      The positions are thereby chosen as the position after which the respective insertion is observed.

      FIXME: In the case of sense orientation and insertions at the very start and anti-sense orientation and insertions at the very end, no position can be selected to assign the insertion to.

      Parameters:
      table - VariantPositionsTable from which variant contents are retrieved.
      referenceAnalysisId - String specifying the reference feature to which regard the insertions are extracted.
      sampleName - String specifying the sample for which insertions shall be extracted.
      positions - java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> specifying which positions are scanned for insertions; this should be `table.getAllPositionsIterator(referenceAnalysisId)` in order to obtain a biologically meaningful result.
      asSense - Boolean specifying whether the insertions should be extracted with respect to the sense or anti-sense strand; i.e. if set to false the stored insertions are the reverse complement sequences of the determined insertions and the position is set to - (i+1) if i is the position of the insertion in sense orientation.
      Returns:
      HashMap mapping genome positions to inserted nucleotide sequences.
      Throws:
      MusialBioException - If, during reverse complement computation in the case of anti-sense representation, any base can not be translated.

    • getNucleotideToAminoAcidSequenceMatching

      public static org.javatuples.Pair<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getNucleotideToAminoAcidSequenceMatching​(java.lang.String aminoAcidSequence, java.lang.String nucleotideSequence) throws MusialBioException
      Matches a amino-acid and nucleotide sequence.

      This is done by translating the nucleotide sequence, for every possible frameshift if applicable, into an amino acid sequence and aligning the translated nucleotide sequence with the amino-acid sequence globally.

      The alignment is used to deduce a mapping of nucleotide codons to the amino acid sequence.

      Parameters:
      aminoAcidSequence - String representing a amino-acid sequence.
      nucleotideSequence - String representing a nucleotide sequence.
      Returns:
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> comprising the padded amino acid (at index 0) and nucleotide sequence (at index 1) that were derived as the best alignment.
      Throws:
      MusialBioException - If an error occurs during the translation of the nucleotide sequence, i.e. any codon with a length different than three is detected or any codon can not be translated.

    • globallyMatchNucleotideToAminoAcidSequence

      private static org.javatuples.Triplet<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> globallyMatchNucleotideToAminoAcidSequence​(java.lang.String aaSeq, java.lang.String transAASeq, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> splitNucleotideSequence, java.lang.String truncatedStart, java.lang.String truncatedEnd)
      Matches a nucleotide sequence with an amino-acid sequence based on a global alignment of the amino acid sequence with the translated nucleotide sequence.

      The global gap-affine alignment computation uses the BLOSUM80 scoring matrix, can handle any amino-acid symbolized by an 'X' and uses an gap-opening and extension penalty of 6 and 4, respectively.

      The aligned translated nucleotide sequence is mapped back to a nucleotide sequence and possible truncated nucleotides are re-appended. The aligned amino-acid sequence is represented as three-letter code amino-acids separated by a separator symbol. The aligned nucleotide sequence is represented by blocks of length three, i.e. codons, separated by a separator symbol. Instead of the common alignment gap symbol '-', the symbol '_' is used as '-' is internally reserved for deletions wrt. nucleotide sequences.

      Parameters:
      aaSeq - String representing a non-nucleotide-derived amino acid sequence.
      transAASeq - String representing a amino acid sequence that originates from translating a nucleotide sequence.
      splitNucleotideSequence - String the original nucleotide sequence split into chunks of length three, i.e. codons.
      truncatedStart - String nucleotides that were truncated from the start of the nucleotide sequence due to a frameshift.
      truncatedEnd - String nucleotides that were truncated from the end of the nucleotide sequence due to a frameshift.
      Returns:
      Triplet yielding the alignment score in the first field, the matched amino-acid sequence in the second field and the matched nucleotide sequence in the third field.

    • matchDataToStructure

      public static org.json.simple.JSONObject matchDataToStructure​(VariantPositionsTable variantsTable, java.lang.String referenceAnalysisId, org.biojava.nbio.structure.Structure proteinStructure, java.lang.String chainId, java.lang.String chainAsymId, boolean isSense) throws MusialBioException
      Allocates sample variants data and nucleotide reference data to a specified reference protein structures chain positions.
      Parameters:
      variantsTable - VariantPositionsTable instance yielding all sample variants information.
      referenceAnalysisId - String specifying the reference feature that shall be allocated to the protein structure.
      proteinStructure - Structure yielding the protein structure that shall be used as the with the reference feature associated protein structure.
      chainId - String chain identifier to access protein data from Structure objects and naming.
      chainAsymId - String internal chain identifier to access protein data from Structure objects.
      isSense - Boolean indicating whether the feature to analyze is located on the sense strand.
      Returns:
      JSONObject yielding sample and reference nucleotide information allocated to protein positions.
      Throws:
      MusialBioException - If any invoked method call (i.e. codon translation or base reversal) throws this exception.

    • translateNucSequence

      public static java.lang.String translateNucSequence​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> splitNucSequence) throws MusialBioException
      Translates a nucleotide sequence, split into codons of length three, into a single-letter amino acid sequence.
      Parameters:
      splitNucSequence - java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> representing a nucleotide sequence that was split into codons of length 3.
      Returns:
      String representing the translated nucleotide sequence.
      Throws:
      MusialBioException - If any codon with a length different than three is detected.

    • getReverseComplement

      public static java.lang.String getReverseComplement​(java.lang.String sequence) throws MusialBioException
      Returns the reverse complement of the passed nucleotide sequence.
      Parameters:
      sequence - String representing a nucleotide sequence.
      Returns:
      String representing the reverse complement of the passed sequence.
      Throws:
      MusialBioException - If any base occurs in the sequence that can not be reversed, i.e. for which no complement base is known.

    • invertBase

      public static java.lang.Character invertBase​(char base) throws MusialBioException
      Returns the complement of a nucleotide base, i.e. switches A to T, C to G and vice versa. For non nucleotide symbols, e.g. gaps (-) or any nucleotides (N), the identity is returned.
      Parameters:
      base - Character base to invert.
      Returns:
      Character the inverted base.
      Throws:
      MusialBioException - If no complement base for the specified base is known.

    • translateCodon

      public static java.lang.String translateCodon​(java.lang.String codon, boolean asAA3, boolean includeTermination) throws MusialBioException
      Returns a String representing the one-letter code of the amino-acid that is translated from the passed nucleotide codon.
      Parameters:
      codon - String representing the nucleotide codon to translate.
      asAA3 - Boolean whether the codon should be translated to the amino-acid three-letter code or not.
      includeTermination - Boolean whether a representation for translation termination (in the case of three-letter code 'TER' and in the case of one-letter code 'Z') shall be returned or not, i.e. an empty String is returned instead.
      Returns:
      String representing a translated amino-acid.
      Throws:
      MusialBioException - If the passed codon has a length other than three.

    • removeGapsFromSequence

      public static java.lang.String removeGapsFromSequence​(java.lang.String sequence)
      Removes all gap symbols ("-") from the passed sequence.
      Parameters:
      sequence - The sequence from which gaps should be removed.
      Returns:
      String, the passed sequence without any gap symbols.

    • getSequencesFromPdb

      public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> getSequencesFromPdb​(org.biojava.nbio.structure.Structure structure)
      Returns the chains sequences from a Structure instance parsed from a .pdb file.
      Parameters:
      structure - Structure instance to extract the chains sequences from.
      Returns:
      HashMap storing the .pdb files amino-acid sequences per chain.

    • getFirstResidueNumberFromProteinStructure

      public static int getFirstResidueNumberFromProteinStructure​(org.biojava.nbio.structure.Structure structure, java.lang.String chainAsymId)
      Returns the first residue number from a Structure instances specified chain (via chainId).
      Parameters:
      structure - Structure instance to access.
      chainAsymId - String representing the AsymId of the chain to access.
      Returns:
      The first residue number of the specified structure and chain.

    • getResiduesFromStructure

      public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​org.biojava.nbio.structure.Group> getResiduesFromStructure​(org.biojava.nbio.structure.Structure structure)
      Returns a HashMap mapping residue number and chain names as (concatenated) keys to the respective Group instances.
      Parameters:
      structure - Structure instance to extract the residue Group objects from.
      Returns:
      The mapping of residue identifiers to residues.

    • getSidechainCentersOfMass

      public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double>> getSidechainCentersOfMass​(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​org.biojava.nbio.structure.Group> residues)
      Computes the side-chains center of mass for a specified set of amino-acid residues represented as Group objects.
      Parameters:
      residues - HashMap mapping from residue identifiers to Group instances.
      Returns:
      The mapping of residue identifiers to residue side-chains center of mass.
